dmca.title: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Rocky Mountain-columbine cease desist.doc]
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: abuseadm@theplanet.com [mailto:abuseadm@theplanet.com] On Behalf
Of Policy Enforcement
Posted At: Tuesday, May 16, 2006 11:24 AM
Posted To: Copyright
Conversation: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Rocky Mountain-columbine cease desist.doc]
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Rocky Mountain-columbine cease desist.doc]


-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

For your review.

Thank you,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/

- -------- Original Message --------
Subject:         [ABUSE] Rocky Mountain-columbine cease desist.doc
Date:         Tue, 16 May 2006 09:45:14 -0400
From:         Giles, Dave <Dave.Giles@scripps.com>
To:         <abuse@theplanet.com>



I am attaching a cease and desist letter that has been sent to a
videogame web site that is being hosted by your company.  The letter
advises that the game creator and operator are illegally using materials
that are the rightful copyright of The Rocky Mountain News.  I would
appreciate your assistance to the extent possible regarding this matter.

David M. Giles
Associate General Counsel
The E.W. Scripps Company
312 Walnut Street, Suite 2800
Cincinnati, OH 45202
(513) 977-3891

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v1.2.5 (MingW32)

iD8DBQFEafycvK/XpJs6oyURAoZ0AJ9aj6usEdP9/SNqxbu6WOflKLhrRACePrVb
JWdyhPRLenFerwMxNbbKHuk=
=sYVW
-----END PGP SIGNATURE-----



---Attached---
May 16, 2006

Via Web Posting

Owner and Originator
www.columbinegame.com

Re:	Unauthorized Use of Photographs

Dear Sir:

The E.W. Scripps Company is the parent company of The Rocky Mountain News in Denver, Colorado.  In that capacity, it has come to my attention that a web site created by you to display a video game about the Columbine High School massacre has been brought to my attention.

Based upon my review of the web site www.columbinegame.com, it is clear that you are using several Pulitzer Prize winning photographs taken by photographers employed by The Rocky Mountain News at the time of the shootings.  Please be advised that those photographs are the copyrighted property of The Rocky Mountain News.  

There is no record of you requesting or receiving permission to use any photographs from the Rocky Mountain News on your web site or in the video game.  Therefore, I request that you immediately cease and desist from using any photographs taken by, originally published by or owned by The Rocky Mountain News.  Any failure to abide by this request could result in litigation, which would include a request for an injunction. 

Thank you for your anticipated cooperation in this regard.  Nothing contained in this letter constitutes an express or implied waiver of any rights, remedies, or defenses of The E.W. Scripps Company or The Rocky Mountain News.  

Sincerely, 


DAVID M. GILES
Associate General Counsel
The E. W. Scripps Company
312 Walnut Street, Suite 2800
Cincinnati, OH 45202
(513) 977-3891
dave.giles@scripps.com

c:  	Mr. John Temple
